item.description:
{6 - 56.58.68.71.73.94}

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Spend the weekend biking and camping in beautiful Cape Cod!

Arrive Friday for two nights' camping and enjoy an included group barbecue on Saturday!

We'll ride along the 22-mile Cape Cod Rail Trail, hike along the ocean and marshes, lounge on the beach, enjoy a big dinner together, and relax with a drink by the fire when the day is through. You can also bring a kayak if you wish. There are numerous places to paddle from. This will be both an active and a very relaxing weekend.

The biking can be as strenuous or as easy as you want it to be. The Rail Trail is paved so all bicycle types are welcome, and it's generally very flat so we can concentrate on the beautiful scenery.

I'll organize group rides & hikes throughout the weekend that you can opt in or out of.

*Price includes a hearty dinner of grilled meats and salads on Saturday!*

Reservations are limited due to park regulations and available campsites. Please don't wait to sign up.

Payment can be made online or by sending a check to:
Larry Pilla, 21 Baker St. Dover, NH 03820

Your spot is guaranteed upon receipt of payment.

Alcohol is "officially" prohibited in Mass State Parks so drinks should keep a low profile.

Camping Gear: We will be tent camping so bring everything you'll need. If you're short on gear, many of us have extra tents, sleeping bags, stoves, etc. to lend. JUST ASK.

If you have a trailer/RV of any kind that you want to bring, please let me know way ahead of time.

Nearby bike rental shops:

Barbs Bikes: http://www.barbsbikeshop.com/

Brewster Bikes: http://www.brewsterbike.com/

Rail Trail Bikes: http://www.railtrailbikeshop.com/

Kayaks: Click here to reserve rental kayaks for the weekend.

Weather: I guarantee that the weather will be gorgeous.* However, campground reservations were made months in advance and cannot be changed. We will have a lot of fun regardless of the weather. That, I really can guarantee!

*Gorgeous weather not guaranteed.

The Cape Cod Rail Trail follows a former railroad right-of-way for 22 miles through the towns of Dennis, Harwich, Brewster, Orleans, Eastham and Wellfleet. Its paved surface, few hills, and well-marked automobile crossings make it ideal for cyclists. The trail has a wide unpaved shoulder on one side to accommodate horseback riding, walkers, and runners.

There are many opportunities to get off the trail and visit a beach. Food and water are also readily available and public restrooms can be found at Nickerson State Park, Salt Pond Visitors Center at Cape Cod National Seashore and the National Seashore Headquarters. If you do not have a bike, bike rentals are available at many points along the way. For people with disabilities, a limited number of hand-cycles are available for rent at specific bike concessions.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.
Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.

Please review the cancellation policy. Reservations and non-refundable payments need to be made by your organizer months in advance in order to offer fun trips like this.
item.name: Cape Cod Camp, Bike, & Barbecue!
